p: Black neighborhoods in California’s urban regions experienced only slightly greater temperature disparities than in other Southwestern locations. On average heat days, California’s top-decile Black neighborhoods were 0.9 °C (1.6 °F) warmer than their lowest-decile counterparts, while the average disparity in other Southwestern metro areas was 0.5 °C (0.8 °F). On extreme heat days, both groups’ disparities were just under 1.1 °C (2 °F).
